Definition at line 31 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h">BitstreamWriter.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Constructors

### BitstreamWriter() {#a5f6ee363763723bf98da451e95bb1d1c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::BitstreamWriter::BitstreamWriter (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OutStream, uint32&#95;t FlushThreshold=512)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Create a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitstreamwriter">BitstreamWriter</a> over a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> <code>OutStream</code>.

If <code>OutStream</code> is a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-svector-ostream">raw&#95;svector&#95;ostream</a>, the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitstreamwriter">BitstreamWriter</a> will write directly to the latter&#39;s buffer. In all other cases, the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitstreamwriter">BitstreamWriter</a> will use an internal buffer and flush at the end of its lifetime.

In addition, if <code>is</code> a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-fd-stream">raw&#95;fd&#95;stream</a> supporting seek, tell, and read (besides write), the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitstreamwriter">BitstreamWriter</a> will also flush incrementally, when a subblock is finished, and if the FlushThreshold is passed.

NOTE: <code>FlushThreshold&#39;s</code> unit is <a href="/docs/api/classes/mb">MB</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h/#l00156">156</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h">BitstreamWriter.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### BitstreamWriter() {#a3cbc68c0f33ec6c72b69a595c36d15c1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::BitstreamWriter::BitstreamWriter (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; Buff)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Convenience constructor for users that start with a vector - avoids needing to wrap it in a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-svector-ostream">raw&#95;svector&#95;ostream</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h/#l00163">163</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h">BitstreamWriter.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### EmitRecordWithBlob() {#a5f4f488b3478316b8d6bb3582b158673}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename Container&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::BitstreamWriter::EmitRecordWithBlob (unsigned Abbrev, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> Container &amp; Vals, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Blob)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
EmitRecordWithBlob - Emit the specified record to the stream, using an abbrev that includes a blob at the end.

The blob data to emit is specified by the pointer and length specified at the end. In contrast to EmitRecord, this routine expects that the first entry in Vals is the code of the record.

### getMarkedBufferAndResumeFlushing() {#a1817d94003400d1a95d6a35a5efe574f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="StringRef llvm::BitstreamWriter::getMarkedBufferAndResumeFlushing ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
resumes flushing, but does not flush, and returns the section in the internal buffer starting from the position marked with markAndBlockFlushing.

The return should be processed before any additional calls to this object, because those may cause a flush and invalidate the return.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h/#l00186">186</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h">BitstreamWriter.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### markAndBlockFlushing() {#a063bf32f685de649ee8239a8e54da868}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::BitstreamWriter::markAndBlockFlushing ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
For scenarios where the user wants to access a section of the stream to (for example) compute some checksum, disable flushing and remember the position in the internal buffer where that happened.

Must be paired with a call to getMarkedBufferAndResumeFlushing.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h/#l00176">176</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h">BitstreamWriter.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### EmitRecordWithAbbrevImpl() {#a43f7317873888110025bf0f2369d38d4}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename uintty&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::BitstreamWriter::EmitRecordWithAbbrevImpl (unsigned Abbrev, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uintty &gt; Vals, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Blob, std::optional&lt; unsigned &gt; Code)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
EmitRecordWithAbbrevImpl - This is the core implementation of the record emission code.

If BlobData is non-null, then it specifies an array of data that should be emitted as part of the Blob or Array operand that is known to exist at the end of the record. If Code is specified, then it is the record code to emit before the Vals, which must not contain the code.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h/#l00459">459</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitstream/bitstreamwriter-h">BitstreamWriter.h</a>.

### FlushToFile() {#a15d6f1a9a10e0e7cb39cc0cff8b2fbe5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::BitstreamWriter::FlushToFile (bool OnClosing=false)"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
If the related file stream is a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-fd-stream">raw&#95;fd&#95;stream</a>, flush the buffer if its size is above a threshold.

If <code>OnClosing</code> is true, flushing happens regardless of thresholds.

Internal buffer for unflushed bytes (unless there is no stream to flush to, case in which these are &quot;the bytes&quot;).

The writer backpatches, so it is efficient to buffer.

### FS {#ad396113421e9eea552c282d2cc4a23f1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>raw&#95;ostream&#42; const llvm::BitstreamWriter::FS</>}>
FS - The file stream that Buffer flushes to.

If FS is a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-fd-stream">raw&#95;fd&#95;stream</a>, the writer will incrementally flush at subblock boundaries. Otherwise flushing will happen at the end of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitstreamwriter">BitstreamWriter</a>&#39;s lifetime.
